references: The big data table is vertically split, such that the data are split in the feature dimension among parties;

First, we study the performance of RL-SecureBoost in security. Following the analysis in SectionÂ 7, we evaluate information leakage in terms of leaf purity. Also, we know that as the leaf purity in the first tree increases, leaked information is reduced. Thereby, to verify the security of RL-SecureBoost, we have to illustrate that the first tree of RL-SecureBoost perform well enough to reduce the information leaked from the second tree. As shown in TableÂ I, we compare the mean leaf purity of the first tree with the second tree. In particular, the mean leaf purity is the weighted average, which is calculated by âˆ‘i=0kninâ€‹pisuperscriptsubscriptğ‘–0ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘›ğ‘–ğ‘›subscriptğ‘ğ‘–\sum_{i=0}^{k}\frac{n_{i}}{n}p_{i}. Here, kğ‘˜k and nğ‘›n represents number of leaves and number of instances in total. pisubscriptğ‘ğ‘–p_{i} and nisubscriptğ‘›ğ‘–n_{i} are defined as leaf purity and number of instances associated with leaf iğ‘–i. According to TableÂ I, the mean leaf purity decreases significantly from the first to the second tree on both datasets, which reflects a great reduction in information leakage. Moreover, the mean leaf purity of the second tree is just over 0.60.60.6 on both datasets, which is good enough to ensure a safe protocol.

references: Next, to investigate the prediction performance of RL-SecureBoost, we compare RL-SecureBoost with SecureBoost with respect to the the first treeâ€™s performance and the overall performance. We consider commonly used metrics including accuracy, Area under ROC curve (AUC) and f1-score. The results are presented in TableÂ II. As observed, RL-SecureBoost performs equally well compared to SecureBoost in almost all cases. We also conduct a pairwise Wilcoxon signed-rank test between RL-SecureBoost and SecureBoost. The comparison results indicate that RL-SecureBoost is as accurate as SecureBoost, with a significance level of 0.050.050.05. The property of lossless is still guaranteed for RL-SecureBoost.
